Text: The product shall be available during normal business hours. As long as the user has access to the client PC the system will be available 99% of the time during the first six months of operation.
Purpose: The product shall be available during normal business hours
Precondition: As long as the user has access to the client PC
during the first six months of operation

Text: The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds.
Purpose: The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds
Trigger: every 60 seconds

Text: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security
Purpose: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security

Text: If projected on a 10x10 projection screen, 90% of viewers must be able to read Event / Activity data from a viewing distance of 30
Purpose: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security

Text: If projected the data must be understandable. On a 10x10 projection screen 90% of viewers must be able to determine that Events or Activities are occuring in current time from a viewing distance of 100
Purpose: The application shall match the color of the schema set forth by Department of Homeland Security

Text: The product shall respond fast to keep up-to-date data in the display.
Purpose: The product shall respond fast to keep up-to-date data in the display

Text: The product shall refresh the display within 500 milliseconds for 99% of new data arrivals.
Purpose: The product shall refresh the display within 500 milliseconds for 99% of new data arrivals
Trigger: new data arrivals

Text: The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table.
Purpose: The system shall have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table
System_response: have a MDI form that allows for the viewing of the graph and the data table

Text: The system shall display Events in a vertical table by time.
Purpose: display Events in a vertical table by time
System_response: display Events in a vertical table by time

Text: The system shall display the Events in a graph by time.
Purpose: display the Events in a graph by time
System_response: display the Events in a graph by time

Text: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z.
Purpose: All business rules specified in the Disputes System shall be in compliance to the guidelines of Regulation E and Regulation Z

Text: The Disputes application must maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case.  This ensures a complete audit trail if questions arise later on with regard to a particular dispute case.
Purpose: maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case
Action: a detailed history of every action that a user takes
System_response: maintain a detailed history of every action that a user takes on a dispute case

Text: All actions that modify an existing dispute case must be recorded in the case history.
Purpose: All actions that modify an existing dispute case must be recorded in the case history

Text: The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users.
Purpose: The Disputes System must be accessible by both internal and external users

Text: The Disputes System must prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base.
Purpose: prevent users from accessing any dispute cases that do not belong to their cardholder base

Text: The Disputes System will facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface that supports real time responses to the users.
Purpose: facilitate direct data entry of a dispute case via a user interface

Text: The Disputes System must provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions.
Purpose: provide different levels of access with regard to disputes case initiation and follow-up actions

Text: The Disputes System shall provide view access capability for authorized users of the application.
Purpose: provide view access capability

Text: The Disputes System shall provide update access capability for authorized users of the application.
Purpose: provide update access capability

Text: The Disputes System must allow the users to select disputable transactions (based on the age of the transaction) from a user interface and initiate a dispute (ticket retrieval request or chargeback notification) on the selected transaction.
Purpose: allow the users to select disputable transactions
initiate a dispute
Trigger: from a user interface
Condition: based on the age of the transaction
Precondition: the users must be allowed to select disputable transactions
System_response: allow the users to select disputable transactions

Text: The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant.
Purpose: The Disputes System must provide the user the ability to initiate a single dispute case on multiple transactions that belong to a single merchant
Condition: that belong to a single merchant

Text: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request. As part of ticket retrieval creation process, the system must prompt the user to enter all the required information to create the ticket retrieval request. The ticket retrieval request is a document that is sent to merchant inquiring the validity of a transaction.
Purpose: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request
System_response: provide the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request
prompt the user to enter all the required information

Text: The Disputes System must allow the user to create three unique types of ticket retrieval requests. The three types of ticket retrieval requests are (1) Request for original receipt (2) Request for a copy of the receipt or (3) Request for a portfolio.
Purpose: The Disputes System will provide the user the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request
System_response: provide the ability to create or initiate a ticket retrieval request
prompt the user to enter all the required information

Text: The Disputes System must prevent external users from requesting original receipts. Requests for original receipts are restricted to internal users.
Purpose: prevent external users from requesting original receipts
System_response: prevent external users from requesting original receipts

Text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of ticket retrieval request that contains the following information
Purpose: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user

Text: The Disputes System shall allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request. The system must prompt the user to enter the required information to initiate a chargeback request. The chargeback request results in a printed chargeback notification that is sent to merchant indicating that their account will be charged back if no proof is provided that the disputed transaction is valid.
Purpose: allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request
System_response: prompt the user to enter the required information
send a chargeback notification to the merchant

Text: The Disputes System must provide a confirmation to the user upon the creation of a chargeback request. The confirmation must contain the following information
Purpose: allow the user to create or initiate a chargeback request
System_response: prompt the user to enter the required information
send a chargeback notification to the merchant

Text: The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time.
Purpose: The Disputes System shall prevent the creation of duplicate dispute requests 100% of the time

Text: The product shall comply with corporate User Interface Guidelines
Purpose: comply with corporate User Interface Guidelines

Text: The product shall comply with corporate color scheme
Purpose: The product shall comply with corporate color scheme

Text: The appearance of the product shall appear professional
Purpose: The appearance of the product shall appear professional

Text: The software product is expected to run on Windows or Linux platforms.
Purpose: The software product is expected to run on Windows or Linux platforms

Text: The product shall be easy to use by Adjusters and Collision Estimators. 95% of Adjusters and Collision Estimators shall find the product easy to use.
Purpose: The product shall be easy to use by Adjusters and Collision Estimators
Action: find the product easy to use

Text: The product shall increase productivity of Collision Estimators. 80% of the Collision Estimators shall agree their productivity has increase within 1 month of using the product.
Purpose: increase productivity of Collision Estimators

Text: Users shall feel satisfied using the product. 85% of all users will be satisfied with the product.
Purpose: Users shall feel satisfied using the product

Text: The user shall easily locate instructions while using the product. User help can be found within 90% of the system.
Purpose: The user shall easily locate instructions while using the product

Text: The search for recycled parts shall take no longer than 15 seconds. The search results shall be returned in under 15 seconds.
Purpose: The search for recycled parts shall take no longer than 15 seconds

Text: The search for the preferred repair facility shall take no longer than 8 seconds. The preferred repair facility is returned within 8 seconds
Purpose: The search for the preferred repair facility shall take no longer than 8 seconds

Text: The recycled parts audit report shall be returned to the user within 10 seconds. The audit report shall be returned within 10 seconds.
Purpose: The recycled parts audit report shall be returned to the user within 10 seconds
The audit report shall be returned within 10 seconds

Text: The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved within 5 seconds. The save shall occur within 5 seconds.
Purpose: The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved within 5 seconds

Text: The product shall achieve a 98% uptime. The product shall not fail more than 2% of the available online time.
Purpose: achieve a 98% uptime

Text: The average number of recycled parts records per day shall be 50 000.
Purpose: The average number of recycled parts records per day shall be 50 000

Text: For estimators the product shall be able to be operated in a repair facility during dirty and noisy conditions.
Purpose: For estimators the product shall be able to be operated
Trigger: during dirty and noisy conditions

Text: The product shall interface with the ChoiceParts system once per day.
Purpose: The product shall interface with the ChoiceParts system once per day
Trigger: once per day

Text: The maintenance of the product will fall within the established corporate maintenance windows.
Purpose: The maintenance of the product will fall within the established corporate maintenance windows

Text: The product shall be supported using the corporate support center.
Purpose: The product shall be supported

Text: Product installations and upgrades shall be handled by the middleware technology team within established launch time frames.
Purpose: Product installations and upgrades shall be handled
Trigger: within established launch time frames

Text: Only adjusters can request recycled parts audit reports. No users without an adjuster role shall request recycled parts audits.
Purpose: request recycled parts audit reports
Trigger: adjusters

Text: The system shall accept requests for recycled parts audit reports only from users with an 'adjuster' role
Purpose: The system shall accept requests for recycled parts audit reports
Condition: only from users with an 'adjuster' role

Text: Only adjusters with a supervisor role can update preferred repair facility ratings. Users without the supervisor role cannot access the repair facility ratings.
Purpose: update preferred repair facility ratings
Trigger: adjusters with a supervisor role
Condition: Users without the supervisor role cannot access the repair facility ratings

Text: The system shall ensure that only adjusters with a supervisor role access preferred repair facility ratings by displaying the relevant data.
Purpose: ensure that only adjusters with a supervisor role access preferred repair facility ratings

Text: Only collision estimators shall search for recycled parts. Users without the collision estimator role shall not have access to the search for recycled parts.
Purpose: Users with the collision estimator role shall have access to search for recycled parts
Main_actor: Users with the collision estimator role

Text: When a user requests to search for recycled parts, the System shall grant access only if the user is a collision estimator.
Purpose: When a user requests to search for recycled parts, the System shall grant access only if the user is a collision estimator
Trigger: When a user requests to search for recycled parts
Condition: only if the user is a collision estimator
Precondition: the user is a collision estimator

Text: Only valid data shall be entered into the system. No invalid data shall be entered into the system.
Purpose: Only valid data shall be entered into the system
Precondition: No invalid data shall be entered into the system

Text: One insurance company shall not be able to view another insurance companys claim data.
Purpose: One insurance company shall not be able to view another insurance company's claim data

Text: The product shall be free of computer viruses.
Purpose: The product shall be free of computer viruses

Text: The system shall prevent malicious attacks, including denial of service.
Purpose: The system shall prevent malicious attacks

Text: The product must comply with Sarbanes-Oxley.
Purpose: The product must comply with Sarbanes-Oxley

Text: The product shall comply with the estimatics laws relating to recycled parts usage.
Purpose: comply with the estimatics laws relating to recycled parts usage

Text: The product shall comply with insurance regulations regarding claims processing.
Purpose: comply with insurance regulations regarding claims processing

Text: The user shall search for the preferred repair facility using vehicle location and radius in miles
Purpose: The user shall search for the preferred repair facility

Text: The vehicle data shall include vehicle year make and model
Purpose: The vehicle data shall include vehicle year make and model

Text: The vehicle location shall include street address, city, state and zipcode
Purpose: The vehicle location shall include street address, city, state and zipcode
System_response: include street address, city, state and zipcode

Text: The system shall resolve the zipcode for the street address, city and state if zipcode is unknown.
Purpose: The system shall resolve the zipcode for the street address, city and state if zipcode is unknown

Text: The search radius shall be between 1 and 30 miles
The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria
Purpose: The system shall locate the preferred repair facility
System_response: locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings

Text: The adjuster shall enter the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment.
Purpose: The adjuster shall enter the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment

Text: The adjuster shall be able to override the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment.
Purpose: The adjuster shall be able to override the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment

Text: The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user.
Purpose: The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user

Text: The system shall return a list of repair facilities within the radius if the preferred repair facility cannot be determined.
Purpose: The system shall return a list of repair facilities within the radius
Trigger: if the preferred repair facility cannot be determined
Condition: if the preferred repair facility cannot be determined
System_response: return a list of repair facilities within the radius

Text: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using damaged vehicle parts information.
Purpose: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts

Text: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using a list of preferred parts suppliers.
Purpose: The estimator shall search for available recycled parts

Text: The system shall search for available recycled parts for the supplied vehicle parts and suppliers.
Purpose: The system shall search for available recycled parts

Text: The estimator shall search by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers
Purpose: search by zipcode with a radius of 30 miles if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers
Trigger: if no parts are found
Condition: if no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers
Precondition: no parts are found for the preferred parts suppliers

Text: The system shall retain the available recycled parts and suppliers returned from the search.
Purpose: retain the available recycled parts and suppliers
System_response: retain the available recycled parts and suppliers

Text: The available recycled parts information and their suppliers shall be returned to the user.
Purpose: The available recycled parts information and their suppliers shall be returned to the user

Text: The estimator shall apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate.
Purpose: The estimator shall apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate

Text: The estimator shall not apply recycled parts to the collision estimate if no available parts are returned.
Purpose: The estimator shall not apply recycled parts to the collision estimate
Trigger: if no available parts are returned
Condition: if no available parts are returned

Text: The adjuster shall review the collision estimate.
Purpose: The adjuster shall review the collision estimate

Text: The adjuster shall request a recycled parts audit of the collision estimate.
Purpose: The adjuster shall request a recycled parts audit of the collision estimate

Text: The recycled parts search results provided to the estimator shall be retrieved by the system.
Purpose: The recycled parts search results provided to the estimator shall be retrieved by the system

Text: The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.
Purpose: The system shall generate an audit report

Text: The audit report shall include the total number of recycled parts used in the estimate.
Purpose: The audit report shall include the total number of recycled parts used in the estimate
System_response: include the total number of recycled parts used in the estimate

Text: The audit report shall include the number of available recycled parts from the original search results.
Purpose: The audit report shall include the number of available recycled parts from the original search results
System_response: include the number of available recycled parts

Text: The audit report shall include the percentage of available recycled parts used in the estimate
Purpose: The audit report shall include the percentage of available recycled parts used in the estimate
System_response: include the percentage of available recycled parts used in the estimate

Text: The audit report shall include the total score of the audit which sums the individual line items.
Purpose: The audit report shall include the total score of the audit which sums the individual line items

Text: The audit report shall be displayed to the user.
Purpose: The audit report shall be displayed to the user

Text: The audit report shall be available to other adjusters at later points in time.
Purpose: The audit report shall be available to other adjusters at later points in time

Purpose: The user shall select to view the preferred repair facility ratings

Purpose: The user shall enter new ratings based on the audit report

Purpose: The ratings shall be from a scale of 1-10

Text: The ratings shall include categories for attempted use of recycled parts and actual use of recycled parts
Purpose: The ratings shall include categories for attempted use of recycled parts and actual use of recycled parts

Purpose: The user shall select to save the preferred repair facility ratings

Purpose: The product must be designed using Design Patterns and coding best practices

Text: The product is expected to integrate with multiple database management systems.
Purpose: The product is expected to integrate with multiple database management systems

Text: The system supports (but does not require) streamlined staff login methods, for example staff member swipes a card to log into a terminal or the staff member logs into a terminal by using his/her individual login and password.
Purpose: streamlined staff login methods
Trigger: staff member swipes a card
staff member logs into a terminal
Condition: staff member logs into a terminal

Text: System administrators can create reliable report templates that are available to staff, and can be run as is or modified to the staff person's particular needs. Changes in the templates could be done without comprising the results. The administrator can limit the filters and display fields that can be altered to certify a dependable output. For example, front-line staff could set the call number range for a wedding report or add or remove designated display fields from a pick list, but couldn’t alter the template to display deleted items.
Purpose: create reliable report templates
be available to staff
run as is or modified to the staff person's particular needs
Precondition: Changes in the templates could be done without comprising the results
System_response: run as is or modified to the staff person's particular needs
limit the filters and display fields that can be altered to certify a dependable output

Text: System provides distinct, fine-grained permission levels limiting who can create and clone reports. All permissions should be easy to administer. System administrators can create shared folders to allow or disallow staff to run specific reports, and/or to run ad hoc reports on specific sets of data.
Purpose: System provides distinct, fine-grained permission levels limiting who can create and clone reports
System_response: limit who can create and clone reports

Text: System provides a user-friendly interface for designing queries against all record types. Staff can select fields to query; select values from picklist of possible values; select regular expressions from drop-down menu, and use a full range of Boolean operators. Administrators control staff access to tables and fields.
Purpose: System provides a user-friendly interface for designing queries against all record types

Text: The system provides pre-defined reports for consumption by library boards or other consumers.
Purpose: The system provides pre-defined reports for consumption by library boards or other consumers

Text: Transactions are archived in a form that protects patron privacy as defined by State Law, while providing useful demographic statistics.
Purpose: protects patron privacy as defined by State Law
providing useful demographic statistics

Text: System provides the query selections along with the results.
Purpose: System provides the query selections along with the results
System_response: provides the query selections along with the results

Text: System must be able to support the reporting definitions as described in Appendix A.
Purpose: support the reporting definitions
System_response: support the reporting definitions as described in Appendix A

Text: The system produces statistics that can be used to understand and predict patron behavior and use of materials.
Purpose: understand and predict patron behavior and use of materials

Text: The system produces useful demographic statistics, including transactions by geographical regions, age ranges, etc. The data used to produce these statistics must be anonymized, i.e. information that could be used to identify a patron is deleted.
Purpose: The system produces useful demographic statistics
Precondition: The data used to produce these statistics must be anonymized

Text: The system provides an interface showing capacity of all branches (as defined in PINES-014).
Purpose: The system provides an interface showing capacity of all branches
System_response: provides an interface showing capacity of all branches

Text: The system provides reports of missing and damaged items per branch.
Purpose: The system provides reports of missing and damaged items per branch
System_response: reports of missing and damaged items per branch

Text: The system generates a list of items that have been in-transit for more than X days (X configurable), per branch and per system. The report would merge the transit to and transit from into one report for ease of front-line staff use.
Purpose: The system generates a list of items that have been in-transit for more than X days
Trigger: X configurable
System_response: generates a list of items that have been in-transit for more than X days

Text: Queries and reports can be limited or grouped by various patron characteristics, including: age range, zip code, county of residence, home branch, patron type, and preferred language.
Purpose: Queries and reports can be limited or grouped by various patron characteristics

Text: The system generates a list of patrons with no circulation or electronic activity in the last X days (X configurable). List should be configurable to System, Home Library, County, etc.
Purpose: Queries and reports can be limited or grouped by various patron characteristics

Text: Transaction history is maintained for X days (X is configurable); monthly and annual aggregate information is maintained indefinitely.
Purpose: Transaction history is maintained for X days

Text: Transactions can be grouped by hour, terminal, branch, and system. Transactions include check-ins, check-outs, fines collected, patron registrations, etc., and can be queried by all transactions or by type of transaction.
Purpose: Transactions can be grouped by hour, terminal, branch, and system

Text: The system counts all types of check-in individually and cumulatively: book-drop, by terminal, by user or self-service.
Purpose: The system counts all types of check-in individually and cumulatively

Text: The system counts all types of check-out individually and cumulatively: staff check-out, self check-out, staff renewal, self checkout renewal, online renewal, OPAC renewal.
Purpose: The system counts all types of check-out individually and cumulatively

Text: The system counts all hold requests, including how the hold was placed: at a staff desk, at a public computer inside the library, or remotely.
Purpose: The system counts all hold requests

Text: The system can generate a report of transactions (holds placed, holds filled, and check-outs) per patron, per library, per selected group of libraries, per system, per county. The system displays the number of check-outs and placed holds per patron. Holds are subtotaled by type, e.g. active, frozen, and frozen-until holds.
Purpose: generate a report of transactions
display the number of check-outs and placed holds per patron
System_response: display the number of check-outs and placed holds per patron

Text: The system can generate a report of the value of items (based on data in item record) in the entire collection or a portion. Example: staff can obtain value of all items with status of longoverdue, or value of all dvds in children's collection, or value of entire collection.
Purpose: generate a report of transactions
display the number of check-outs and placed holds per patron
System_response: display the number of check-outs and placed holds per patron

Text: All reports and data archiving must comply with standard accounting practice and state, county, and municipal auditing requirements.
Purpose: All reports and data archiving must comply with standard accounting practice and state, county, and municipal auditing requirements

Text: Fines, charges, waivers, and ecommerce transactions are attached to patron and item records. System tracks fines waived and payments made per library. Financial information can be updated easily. As an example, a staff user can easily query patron accounts with balances greater than X dollars.
Purpose: Fines, charges, waivers, and ecommerce transactions are attached to patron and item records
System_response: tracks fines waived and payments made per library
Financial information can be updated easily

Text: The system maintains a ledger of patron payments, including which charges payments are applied to, to facilitate reconciliation.
Purpose: facilitate reconciliation

Text: The user can divide a pdf document into parts, following some options for how to split the document. Then he can save the output pdf files in a directory he wants.
Purpose: facilitate reconciliation

Text: The user has to select the Split option from the plugins tree (or press the "S" key) to display the split panel.
Purpose: display the split panel
Trigger: select the Split option from the plugins tree
press the 'S' key
Condition: select the Split option from the plugins tree

Text: If the document is protected, the user have to enter the password to the appropriate field and then reload the pdf.
Purpose: display the split panel
Trigger: select the Split option from the plugins tree
press the 'S' key
Condition: select the Split option from the plugins tree

Text: The user can split only once document at a time.
Purpose: The user can split only one document at a time

Text: The user has to select the Merge/Extract option from the plugins tree (or press the "M" key) to display the merge/extract panel.
Purpose: display the merge/extract panel
Trigger: select the Merge/Extract option from the plugins tree
press the 'M' key

Text: When the user presses the "M" key, and the Merge panel is currently displayed, the system shall close the Merge panel within 2 seconds.
Purpose: When the user presses the 'M' key, and the Merge panel is currently displayed, the system shall close the Merge panel within 2 seconds
Trigger: When the user presses the 'M' key
Condition: and the Merge panel is currently displayed
Precondition: the Merge panel is currently displayed
System_response: close the Merge panel within 2 seconds

Text: The user presses the RUN button to start the merging of the files.
Purpose: The user presses the RUN button to start the merging of the files
Trigger: The user presses the RUN button

Text: As an Applicant, I want to Submit Application(s) so that I can provide my information, plans and/or documents to initiate a transaction with the County.
Purpose: The user presses the RUN button to start the merging of the files
Trigger: The user presses the RUN button

Text: As an Applicant, I want to submit an application containing my information, plans, and documents to initiate a transaction with the County. The system shall confirm successful submission within a maximum of 5 seconds.
Purpose: submit an application containing my information, plans, and documents to initiate a transaction with the County

Text: As a Customer, I want to Create a Customer Portal User Account so that I can log on to the Customer Portal and perform transactions that first require user authentication.
Purpose: submit an application containing my information, plans, and documents to initiate a transaction with the County

Text: As an Applicant, I want to Request Pre-Application Assistance so that I can receive a response to a request for a meeting or information that is a result of the pre-application assistance.
Purpose: I want to Request Pre-Application Assistance
Trigger: a request for a meeting or information
Condition: the request is a result of the pre-application assistance
System_response: receive a response to a request

Text: As a Prospective Applicant, I want to Research Requirements and Select a Service so that I can find the relevant service and/or application type to initiate via the online portal.
Purpose: I want to Research Requirements and Select a Service
Trigger: I want to Research Requirements and Select a Service

Text: As a Public User, I want to Search for Information so that I can obtain publicly available information concerning properties, County services, processes and other general information.
Purpose: I want to Search for Information

Text: As an Applicant, I want to Submit Supporting Documentation so that I can satisfy documentation requirements for my application.
Purpose: I want to satisfy documentation requirements
Trigger: I want to submit supporting documentation

Text: As an Applicant, I want to Pay Fee(s) so that I can satisfy outstanding charge(s) associated with the service(s) requested or received from the County.
Purpose: I want to satisfy documentation requirements
Trigger: I want to submit supporting documentation

Text: As an Applicant, I want to Check the Status of a transaction(s) so that I can understand where the provisioning of my service is in the process, such as information related to service levels, fees, plan review, permit, or inspection results.
Purpose: I want to Check the Status of a transaction(s)
Trigger: I want to Check the Status of a transaction(s)
Condition: so that I can understand where the provisioning of my service is in the process
System_response: understand where the provisioning of my service is in the process

Text: As an Applicant, I want to Modify my Application so that I can successfully change information on an application.
Purpose: I want to Check the Status of a transaction(s)
Trigger: I want to Check the Status of a transaction(s)
Condition: so that I can understand where the provisioning of my service is in the process
System_response: understand where the provisioning of my service is in the process

Text: As a Staff member, I want to Perform a Completeness Review so that I can validate when an application is complete and eligible for further technical review.
Purpose: Perform a Completeness Review
Trigger: when an application is complete
Main_actor: I want to Perform a Completeness Review
System_response: validate when an application is complete

Text: As a Staff member, I want to Record an Internal Note so that I can share information with other Staff collaborating on the record.
Purpose: Record an Internal Note

Text: As a Staff member (or System), I want to Assign an Application for Detailed Review so that the application can be reviewed for compliance and subsequently approved or denied
Purpose: Assign an Application for Detailed Review
Trigger: I want to
Condition: so that the application can be reviewed for compliance and subsequently approved or denied
System_response: Assign an Application for Detailed Review

Text: The user selects the document he wants to split from a directory. When the file is imported, some information about the file is displayed (such as pages number, pdf version…).
Purpose: Assign an Application for Detailed Review
Trigger: I want to
Condition: so that the application can be reviewed for compliance and subsequently approved or denied
System_response: Assign an Application for Detailed Review

Text: The user selects the destination folder for the output files (specific or same as source). Also, he can select whether he wants the output files to be compressed or not, and the pdf version of the generated documents.
Purpose: Assign an Application for Detailed Review
Trigger: I want to
Condition: so that the application can be reviewed for compliance and subsequently approved or denied
System_response: Assign an Application for Detailed Review

Text: Here, the user can define a pattern that will generate filenames for the output files.
Purpose: Assign an Application for Detailed Review
Trigger: I want to
Condition: so that the application can be reviewed for compliance and subsequently approved or denied
System_response: Assign an Application for Detailed Review

Text: The compression of the output files requires pdf version 1.5 or above.
Purpose: The compression of the output files requires pdf version 1.5 or above

Text: The number of digits that can be used for the unique [FILENUMBER] prefix must be 10 or less.
Purpose: The number of digits that can be used for the unique [FILENUMBER] prefix must be 10 or less

Text: Users can merge many pdf documents or subsections of them together. In the same way, they can extract some sections of a pdf document into a single document.
Purpose: Users can merge many pdf documents or subsections of them together

Text: The GUI Merge/Extract panel enables the user to select more than one file to handle.
Purpose: enable the user to select more than one file to handle

Text: Once the user selects the file/files they are automatically inserted into the selection table with some specific details. Now, the user can change the order and/or select the pages of the file/files that he wants to be included in the final document.
Purpose: enable the user to select more than one file to handle

Text: The user can change the order of the files by using "Move Up" and "Move Down" buttons, or make the list be ordered by the value of a specific column by clicking the header of that column.
Purpose: enable the user to select more than one file to handle

Text: The user has the ability to export the list of the selected files as an xml file that can be used as an input file for the console "concat" command, -l option.
Purpose: enable the user to select more than one file to handle

Text: If the pdf documents contain forms, the user must add that to the merge options.
Purpose: If the pdf documents contain forms, the user must add that to the merge options

Text: Finally, the user selects the output file path or let the PDFsam create one by default to the same folder as one of the imported files. Also, he can select whether he wants the output file to be compressed or not, and the pdf version of the generated document.
Purpose: If the pdf documents contain forms, the user must add that to the merge options

Text: pages number in the page selection must be comprehended
Purpose: If the pdf documents contain forms, the user must add that to the merge options

Text: Users may want to combine documents together by taking pages alternatively from two existing pdf documents (e.g. for documents coming from one-sided scanners). The resulting document will be composed by pages taken alternatively from the two input documents.
Purpose: Users may want to combine documents together

Text: The user selects the two documents that he wants to mix from a directory. When the files are imported, some information about the file are displayed to the selection table (such as pages number, pdf version…).
Purpose: Users may want to combine documents together

Text: The user can change the order of the two files by using “Move Up” and “Move Down” buttons, or make the list be ordered by the value of a specific column by clicking the header of that column.
Purpose: Users may want to combine documents together

Text: As a Staff member, I want to Manage Approved Proffers so that I can ensure compliance with and satisfaction of the proffer in the future.
Purpose: Manage Approved Proffers

Text: As a Staff member, I want to Manage Ordinances so that I can maintain accurate ordinance information in the System.
Purpose: Manage Ordinances

Text: As a staff member, I want to denote an application with a Final Action status (Approved, Approved with Conditions, Denied, etc.)
Purpose: Manage Ordinances

Text: Electronically incorporate the following data expressed according to the specified standard(s).
Purpose: Manage Ordinances

Text: Extract and allow for individual display each additional section or sections (and the accompanying document header information) that were included in a transition of care or referral summary received and formatted in accordance with the standard adopted at § 170.205(a)(3).
Purpose: Manage Ordinances

Text: (2) create and transmit transition of care or referral summaries.
Purpose: create and transmit transition of care or referral summaries
Entity: transition of care or referral summaries
System_response: create and transmit transition of care or referral summaries

Text: Enable a user to electronically create a transition of care or referral summary formatted according to the standard adopted at § 170.205(a)(3) that includes, at a minimum, the Common MU Data Set.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically create a transition of care or referral summary

Text: Enable a user to electronically transmit the transition of care or referral summary created in paragraph (b)(2)(i) of this section in accordance with Electronic prescribing.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically transmit the transition of care or referral summary
Entity: the transition of care or referral summary

Text: Enable a user to electronically create prescriptions and prescription-related information for electronic transmission in accordance with: (i) The standard specified in § 170.205(b)(2); and (ii) At a minimum, the version of the standard specified in § 170.207(d)(2).
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically create prescriptions and prescription-related information for electronic transmission

Text: Enable a user to electronically reconcile the data that represent a patient's active medication, problem, and medication allergy list as follows.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically reconcile

Text: (i) Electronically and simultaneously display (i.e., in a single view) the data from at least two list sources in a manner that allows a user to view the data and their attributes, which must include, at a minimum, the source and last modification date.
Purpose: Electronically and simultaneously display data from at least two list sources

Text: (ii) Enable a user to create a single reconciled list of medications, medication allergies, or problems.
Purpose: Enable a user to create a single reconciled list

Text: (iii) Enable a user to review and validate the accuracy of a final set of data and, upon a user's confirmation, automatically update the list.
Purpose: Enable a user to review and validate the accuracy of a final set of data
Trigger: upon a user's confirmation

Text: (5) Incorporate laboratory tests and values or results.
Purpose: Enable a user to review and validate the accuracy of a final set of data
Trigger: upon a user's confirmation

Text: (i) Receive results.
Purpose: Enable a user to review and validate the accuracy of a final set of data
Trigger: upon a user's confirmation

Text: ( 1 ) Electronically receive and incorporate clinical laboratory tests and values or results in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.205(j) and, at a minimum, the version of the standard specified in § 170.207(c)(2).
Purpose: Enable a user to review and validate the accuracy of a final set of data
Trigger: upon a user's confirmation

Text: ( 2 ) Electronically display the tests and values or results received in human readable format.
Purpose: Electronically display the tests and values or results received
Trigger: electronically
System_response: display the tests and values or results received

Text: Electronically receive clinical laboratory tests and values or results in a structured format and electronically display such tests and values or results in human readable format.
Purpose: Electronically receive clinical laboratory tests and values or results in a structured format

Text: (iii) Electronically attribute, associate, or link a laboratory test and value or result with a laboratory order or patient record.
Purpose: electronically attribute
associate
link a laboratory test and value or result with a laboratory order or patient record

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.205(j) and with laboratory tests expressed in accordance with, at a minimum, the version of the standard specified in § 170.207(c)(2).
Purpose: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission
System_response: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission

Text: Enable a user to electronically create a set of export summaries for all patients in EHR technology formatted according to the standard adopted at § 170.205(a)(3) that represents the most current clinical information about each patient and includes, at a minimum, the Common MU Data Set and the following data expressed, where applicable, according to the specified standard(s):
Purpose: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission
System_response: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission

Text: For each and every CQM for which the EHR technology is presented for certification, EHR technology must be able to electronically record all of the data identified in the standard specified at § 170.204(c) that would be necessary to calculate each CQM.
Purpose: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission
System_response: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission

Text: Data required for CQM exclusions or exceptions must be codified entries, which may include specific terms as defined by each CQM, or may include codified expressions of 'patient reason", "system reason" or "medical reason."
Purpose: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission
System_response: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically export a data file formatted in accordance with the standards specified at § 170.205(h) that includes all of the data captured for each and every CQM to which EHR technology was certified under paragraph (c)(1)(i) of this section.
Purpose: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission
System_response: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically import a data file formatted in accordance with the standard specified at § 170.205(h) and use such data to perform the capability specified in paragraph (c)(2)(ii) of this section.
Purpose: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission
System_response: electronically create laboratory test reports for electronic transmission

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically calculate each and every clinical quality measure for which it is presented for certification.
Purpose: EHR technology must be able to electronically calculate each and every clinical quality measure for which it is presented for certification
Action: must be able to electronically calculate

Text: Enable a user to electronically create a data file for transmission of clinical quality measurement data:
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically create a data file for transmission of clinical quality measurement data

Text: (i) Verify against a unique identifier(s) (e.g.  username or number) that a person seeking access to electronic health information is the one claimed;
Purpose: Verify against a unique identifier(s) that a person seeking access to electronic health information is the one claimed
Trigger: a person seeking access to electronic health information

Text: (ii) Establish the type of access to electronic health information a user is permitted based on the unique identifier(s) provided in paragraph (d)(1)(i) of this section, and the actions the user is permitted to perform with the EHR technology.
Purpose: Verify against a unique identifier(s) that a person seeking access to electronic health information is the one claimed
Trigger: a person seeking access to electronic health information

Text: (A) Record actions related to electronic health information in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(1);
Purpose: Record actions related to electronic health information
Trigger: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(1)
Condition: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(1)

Text: (C) Record the encryption status (enabled or disabled) of electronic health information locally stored on end-user devices by EHR technology in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3) unless the EHR technology prevents electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices (see 170.314(d)(7) of this section).
Purpose: Record the encryption status
Trigger: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3)
Condition: unless the EHR technology prevents electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices
Precondition: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3)

Text: For each capability specified in paragraphs (d)(2)(i)(A) through (C) of this section that EHR technology permits to be disabled, the ability to do so must be restricted to a limited set of identified users.
Purpose: Record the encryption status
Trigger: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3)
Condition: unless the EHR technology prevents electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices
Precondition: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3)

Text: Actions and statuses recorded in accordance with paragraph (d)(2)(i) of this section must not be capable of being changed, overwritten, or deleted by the EHR technology.
Purpose: Record the encryption status
Trigger: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3)
Condition: unless the EHR technology prevents electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices
Precondition: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(e)(3)

Text: EHR technology must be able to detect whether the audit log has been altered.
Purpose: EHR technology must be able to detect whether the audit log has been altered
System_response: detect whether the audit log has been altered

Text: Enable a user to electronically select the record affected by a patient's request for amendment and perform the capabilities specified in paragraphs (d)(4)(i) or (ii) of this section.
Purpose: EHR technology must be able to detect whether the audit log has been altered
System_response: detect whether the audit log has been altered

Text: For an accepted amendment, append the amendment to the affected record or include a link that indicates the amendment's location.
Purpose: EHR technology must be able to detect whether the audit log has been altered
System_response: detect whether the audit log has been altered

Text: For a denied amendment, at a minimum, append the request and denial of the request to the affected record or include a link that indicates this information's location.
Purpose: append the request and denial of the request to the affected record or include a link that indicates this information's location
System_response: append the request and denial of the request to the affected record or include a link that indicates this information's location

Text: Prevent a user from gaining further access to an electronic session after a predetermined time of inactivity.
Purpose: Prevent a user from gaining further access to an electronic session
Trigger: after a predetermined time of inactivity

Text: Permit an identified set of users to access electronic health information during an emergency.
Purpose: Permit an identified set of users to access electronic health information during an emergency
Trigger: during an emergency

Text: (i) EHR technology, that is designed to locally store electronic health information on end-user devices, must encrypt the electronic health information stored on such devices after use of EHR technology on those devices stops.
Purpose: Permit an identified set of users to access electronic health information during an emergency
Trigger: during an emergency

Text: (A) Electronic health information that is stored must be encrypted in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(a)(1).
Purpose: Permit an identified set of users to access electronic health information during an emergency
Trigger: during an emergency

Text: EHR technology must be set by default to perform this capability and, unless this configuration cannot be disabled by any user, the ability to change the configuration must be restricted to a limited set of identified users.
Purpose: Permit an identified set of users to access electronic health information during an emergency
Trigger: during an emergency

Text: (ii) EHR technology is designed to prevent electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices after use of EHR technology on those devices stops.
Purpose: prevent electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices
Trigger: use of EHR technology on those devices stops
Condition: use of EHR technology on those devices stops

Text: (i) Create a message digest in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(c).
Purpose: prevent electronic health information from being locally stored on end-user devices
Trigger: use of EHR technology on those devices stops
Condition: use of EHR technology on those devices stops

Text: (ii) Verify in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(c) upon receipt of electronically exchanged health information that such information has not been altered.
Purpose: Verify in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(c)
Trigger: upon receipt of electronically exchanged health information
Condition: such information has not been altered
Main_actor: The recipient of the health information

Text: Record disclosures made for treatment, payment, and health care operations in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.210(d).
Purpose: Record disclosures made for treatment, payment, and health care operations

Text: Electronically download transition of care or referral summaries that were created as a result of a transition of care (pursuant to the capability expressed in the certification criterion adopted at paragraph (b)(2) of this section).
Purpose: download transition of care or referral summaries
Trigger: as a result of a transition of care
Condition: pursuant to the capability expressed in the certification criterion adopted at paragraph (b)(2) of this section
Precondition: transition of care or referral summaries were created
Entity: transition of care or referral summaries
System_response: electronically download transition of care or referral summaries

Text: Electronically transmit transition of care or referral summaries (as a result of a transition of care or referral) selected by the patient (or their authorized representative) in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.202(a).
Purpose: Electronically transmit transition of care or referral summaries
Trigger: selected by the patient (or their authorized representative)
Condition: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.202(a)

Text: (A) When electronic health information is viewed, downloaded, or transmitted to a third-party using the capabilities included in paragraphs (e)(1)(i)(A) through (C) of this section, the following information must be recorded and made accessible to the patient:
Purpose: Electronically transmit transition of care or referral summaries
Trigger: selected by the patient (or their authorized representative)
Condition: in accordance with the standard specified in § 170.202(a)

Text: (B) EHR technology presented for certification may demonstrate compliance with paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) of this section if it is also certified to the certification criterion adopted at § 170.314(d)(2) and the information required to be recorded in paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) is accessible by the patient.
Purpose: compliance with paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) of this section
Condition: if it is also certified to the certification criterion adopted at § 170.314(d)(2)
Precondition: the information required to be recorded in paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) is accessible by the patient

Text: Enable a user to create a clinical summary for a patient in human readable format and formatted according to the standards adopted at § 170.205(a)(3).
Purpose: compliance with paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) of this section
Condition: if it is also certified to the certification criterion adopted at § 170.314(d)(2)
Precondition: the information required to be recorded in paragraph (e)(1)(ii)(A) is accessible by the patient

Text: Enable a user to customize the data to be included in the clinical summary.
Purpose: Enable a user to customize the data to be included in the clinical summary

Text: EHR technology must permit a user to select, at a minimum, the following data when creating a clinical summary:
Purpose: Enable a user to customize the data to be included in the clinical summary

Text: Enable a user to electronically send messages to, and receive messages from, a patient in a manner that ensures that Both the patient (or authorized representative) and EHR technology user are authenticated
Purpose: Enable a user to customize the data to be included in the clinical summary

Text: (ii) The message content is encrypted and integrity-protected in accordance with the standard for encryption and hashing algorithms specified at § 170.210(f).
Purpose: The message content is encrypted and integrity-protected
Entity: standard for encryption and hashing algorithms

Text: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access immunization information.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access immunization information

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically create immunization information for electronic transmission in accordance with, At a minimum, the version of the standard specified in § 170.207(e)(2).
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access immunization information

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically create syndrome-based public health surveillance information for electronic transmission in accordance with Ambulatory setting only.
Purpose: electronically create syndrome-based public health surveillance information
Trigger: in accordance with Ambulatory setting only
Condition: in accordance with Ambulatory setting only

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically create reportable laboratory tests and values or results for electronic transmission in accordance with The standard (and applicable implementation specifications) specified in § 170.205(g)
Purpose: electronically create syndrome-based public health surveillance information
Trigger: in accordance with Ambulatory setting only
Condition: in accordance with Ambulatory setting only

Text: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information

Text: EHR technology must be able to electronically create cancer case information for electronic transmission in accordance with the standard (and applicable implementation specifications) specified in § 170.205(i);
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information

Text: For each meaningful use objective with a percentage-based measure, EHR technology must be able to create a report or file that enables a user to review the patients or actions that would make the patient or action eligible to be included in the measure's numerator.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information

Text: The information in the report or file created must be of sufficient detail such that it enables a user to match those patients or actions to meet the measure's denominator limitations when necessary to generate an accurate percentage.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information

Text: For each meaningful use objective with a percentage-based measure that is supported by a capability included in an EHR technology, electronically record the numerator and denominator and create a report including the numerator, denominator, and resulting percentage associated with each applicable meaningful use measure.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information

Text: User-centered design processes must be applied to each capability an EHR technology includes that is specified in the following certification criteria: § 170.314(a)(1)  (2)  (6) through (8)  and (16) and (b)(3) and (4).
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information

Text: For each capability that an EHR technology includes and for which that capability's certification is sought, the use of a Quality Management System (QMS) in the development, testing, implementation and maintenance of that capability must be identified.
Purpose: Enable a user to electronically record, change, and access cancer case information
